Reviews.Title: “Not wonderful, neither awful”
Reviews.Author: x_kRikKa_x
Reviews.Content: I think that what really saves the hotel's reputation is the service. People who worked at the hotel were extremely kind. Getting from the center to the hotel takes, for example to Termini, 15 mins walk + 25 mins subway. It's OK if you intend to leave in the morning and come back at the end of the day only. There's also a shuttle bus from 9.15 to 10.15 am and another one in the evening-night until 10.45 pm, which is fine if your plans coincide with the timeline. But if you decide to go back later at night, walking through the industrial area around the hotel may be a bit scary, since it's a dark empty road with no houses around. Room was very clean, but we were put in the disabled adapted room with no shower plate, so the whole bathroom would be flooded whenever we showered and had to lay towels on the floor to be able to enter again without wetting our feet. We were also next to the cafeteria, so at 7am it was very noisy with all the people having breakfast. We could also hear everything from the room next to ours. Breakfast was VERY limited. All sweets, sweets, sweets. Only 1 type of bread, very chewy and hard to eat, only toasts available were industrial ones on package and only one type of coffee (filter/American coffee) with no option of expresso. Excluding drinks, I guess the only non sweets that were available was the cheese, ham, bread, toast, butter, corn flakes, muesli and natural yoghurt. We'd think twice about being hosted at that hotel again. But it ain't the worst hotel, though. Environment is good, service is good, rooms are nice and clean, free Internet available. Location and breakfast were the most negative aspects. And also ain't a bad idea of getting hungry at night, since there's no kitchen available at the hotel (at least at 9.30pm there wasn't) and there's no one near enough to go get something to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Travellers beware”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I accompanied by 2 other couples arranged a stay at the Park Hotel Ginevra. We arrived in Rome after a really long night and our first clue was that the shuttle from the hotel didn’t show up. we went by cab and upon our arrival were told that although we had a reservation made several weeks before, it had been cancelled and no rooms where available. Upon viewing our confirmation we were provided with rooms but the rate was 20 Euro per night more than originally quoted. Aside from that The hotel and the staff were very good.

Reviews.Title: “hotel good but beware of congame at hotel”
Reviews.Author: jascom
Reviews.Content: we three couples stayed at hotel park ginerva from october 7th to 10th for three nights. we booked hotel atleast six weeks before going to rome and we had confirmation of reservation. when we got to hotel on 7th from canada after long flight.they told us our reservation was cancelled by us.we are seniors and we didnot cancel our reservation.why we would do that and still go to hotel and pay 90 euros for taxi.we met some other people at hotel who had the same experience.Elso the desk clerk at hotel and walter the manager at hotel told us they were having problem with their website.they were smerking and rude and told us there are norooms for us.can you imagine three senior couples stranded in rome.after little bit of argument and begging they said perhaps i repeat perhaps they can find us some rooms in hotel if we paid 20 euros more per night.we said ok we will pay 20 euros per night more.guess what suddenly three rooms appeared empty and they gave us those rooms and charged us more money.all the time they were smirking and laughing how they conned us for more money. If the hotel owners had any class at all they should fire elso and walter.and returh our money. But there were good things at hotel. Rooms were good and modern.bathroom were nice.breakfast was quite nice. there were some nice staff at hotel who were nice to us and they helped us.stafano was very good and helped us and sympathised with us.salvatore was very good.marika and other young lady serving breakfast were also very good. they had shuttle to metro station battistini but it never worked as shuttle had flat tire and they will not get it fixed.you asked for second key to room and elso said its not possible. elso and walter need more training and change of attitude. hotel was good just some staff issues.

Reviews.Title: “Edge of City, but good if you have a Car. Shuttle service to Metro Line A West.”
Reviews.Author: PeterL67
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, very modern & very comfortable beds. Covered car park, standard breakfast, helpful & friendly service. 10-15 mins walk to Metro Line A West. Free shuttle bus at convenient times. You can drive to Rome & park there after 6pm - though you should be a confident driver to try this.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value-for-money choices!”
Reviews.Author: Angelos A
Reviews.Content: One of the best choices you can make if you want to travel to Rome and not spend enough money on your stay! Clean, quiet and with very good service. Location is really a subject, though, since it is found way far from the historical center or the closest metro station, but you can either use the free shuttle bus to Metro station Battistini or walk for 5 minutes and get bus No 889 that gets you to Metro Station Cornelia. The morning itierearies of the bus are very helpful (09.30, 09.50, 10.10) but the night ones really don't come in handy, since they begin at 21.15 while the metro closes at 21.00. So, be careful and organize your transportation thoroughly, especially if walking -a lot- is really an important issue for you. Apart from that, we were very satisfied from our option! Breakfast sufficient, staff very helpful (speaking english), rooms clean (we had our towels changed every 2 days), TV, safety box (no mini bar though), free WiFi connection (on demand) and quiet environment that really gave us some very relaxing hours of sleep that would take us through the very demanding and exhausting daytime with all the sightseeing. If you are a group of friends travelling or a young couple and you don't mind wasting some time to get from and to the hotel, this hotel should definitely be on your priority list!

Reviews.Title: “Make the best of it....”
Reviews.Author: robispho
Reviews.Content: First the plusses: Not expensive.. Nice staf..Good beds... But, way too far from the nearrest metrostation. Ok, they have a litttle (drop-off) van but when you want to come or go earlier or later....a long walk (in a unfriendly neighbourhood). Some problems with shower, tv, ...the room was not clean, too smal etc. Overall: it was ok, but not a second time for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, very nice accommodations”
Reviews.Author: melissawolf14
Reviews.Content: This place is a bit off the beaten path, but overall, not horrible to find and get to. We took the A line to the last stop at Battistini and then walked from there. The rooms are modern and very clean and the price was fantastic. For us, it was worth trekking out a bit further to stay in a more modern hotel for a few nights. They also had a shuttle that went to/from the train stop, if you aren't up for the extra walking (there's a sizeable hill at the end!). The staff was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is lovely, CLEAN and Family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Vfamily_11
Reviews.Content: Don't worry about the location because the hotel has a shuttle from the hotel (9am) to the train station and from the train station (last trip-12 midnight I think). Staff are very friendly and will give you a map for the best tourist spot in Rome and will tell you which station you should get off. Food was lovely, room and bathroom were clean and looks new . I highly recommend this hotel and had been recommending it to my friends (good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel esp the price, but there's a catch!”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug365_UK
Reviews.Content: A fairly new, modern and well run hotel. More like a motel with the size of it but very well priced considering its in Rome. The rooms are just about big enough although the bathroom is tiny, enough room for the essentials and that's it! Breakfast is basic but good. Service is friendly and efficient. I had problems with the safe not locking and it was soon sorted. To get to the hotel I'd recommend the 45 Euro shuttle taxi that they can organise if you email them, they need about 2 days notice for this. Its the same price whether you fly into Fuimicino or Ciampino. The big downside of this hotel is the time it takes to get in and out of the heart of Rome. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the nearest Metro (and nearest restaurant). You have to go up and down the hill to the hotel and the route is not exactly well lit at night! You then have another 20 minutes to get to the centre of Rome on the Metro. Its not the end of the world but certainly makes it a drag if you want to come back to the hotel after a days sightseeing, freshen up and then go out again in the evening. However, this is certainly reflected in the price, if you want to be a short stroll from the Trevi fountain etc be prepared to pay 2 or 3 times a night what this hotel is charging. Overall, I'd recommend it if you only have a day or so in Rome. If you want the 4 or 5 day full experience with Rome by night you would probably get fed up with the 'commuting'. The comments on here about the hotel shuttle service are also very true, this next to useless because of the times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect outpost for Rome exploration”
Reviews.Author: NWWildTurtle
Reviews.Content: Located off the road circling Rome (GRA off Uscita 2) the Park Hotel was a quiet base for our exploration of Rome. The Battistini Metro station is only a few blocks away - walkable or there is a morning and evening shuttle - that takes you directly to the center of the city. Rome is expensive, there's no way around it. The room rate was "city" reasonable, and included continental breakfast, in-room wifi, and covered parking. Located in a primarily residential area, the hotel is quiet at night. There are no restaurants in the immediate area - some seemed to be near the metro - but you're in Rome, so go into the city to eat. There is a small bar in the hotel with coffee and what looked like the potential for mixed drinks, although nobody was partaking while we were there. There is a rooftop patio for those interested in getting some sun or relaxing in the evening. The one downside goes back to the location - because it isn't in an area filled with hotels, the access street could be a little iffy to walk if in the dark. The shuttle runs to and from the metro stop in the evening between 9 and 10, and I would recommend using it if you're getting back that late from the city. We walked in the early morning and evening and were fine. The airport is only about 20 minutes from the hotel, which made our car return and departure easy. I would recommend the Park Hotel Ginevra for travelers who want to experience Rome but not stay in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: EsmeLoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, but hotel location is not convenience. Hotel located in residential area, so it is quiet place and relax. Me and my friend enjoy to stay there for 2 nights, it provide a silent and peace at the roof top for us to chat, drinking beer and make fun. The hotel providing private and safe for two ladies like us, we really enjoy. The only terible thing was, we had used almost one hour to find the hotel, and 30 minutes by walk to search for it. Asking aound the residents but nobody knows. By the way, if you follow the instruction properly given by hotel staff, think it is not a problem. After check-in, finally we manage to go out to town, and back to hotel easily. Hotel do provide shuttle bus but not frequent, and at fist we hop off at the wrong metro station, so this had mess up trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel...bad neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: R0BIE
Reviews.Content: Brand new hotel, very comfortable and modern rooms. Lcd tv, minibar, safe, large bad, auto-clima,free parking... etc. Spotless cleaning and friendly staff. The only bad things are the bad neighbourhood(far away from the metro and bus) and the poor breakfast. Overall....TOP value for money for a short Rome vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the super new and clean hotel but it's really far away!”
Reviews.Author: Patriciapv
Reviews.Content: They just opened their doors this March, so it's clean, modern and by far the best included breakfast of our trip. They have great staff and are always helpful. They offer a shuttle service to the nearest metro station so you can save the long walk or the short walk plus bus ride to that station, but the shuttle starts pretty late, around 9:30 am and since we had booked tours that started much earlier we were never able to use that service. Later at night we went out to have dinner and again, weren't able to get a ride on their van, so my advise is: If you can afford a taxi, this is the best hotel for the price, if not, you are better off in a hotel that's closer to central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for your stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: eirka
Reviews.Content: The only disadvantage of this hotel is its distance from the historical center of Rome. We walked to the metro station, sometimes we used the hotel's free shuttle service and two nights that we stayed out late we took a taxi for about 15 euros. The hotel is newly built, with comfortable, modern rooms, cleaned in an everyday basis. Τhe breakfast was ok but they didn't freshen it regularly. I would definetely suggest it for your stay in Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Park Hotel Ginevra
HotelInfo.Address: 35 via San Giovanni della Croce, 00166 Rome, Italy
